thread.title: Latest: Wal-Mart stock dives; HSBC orders pay cuts
thread.title_full: Latest: Wal-Mart stock dives; HSBC orders pay cuts

author: yahoo
title: Latest: Wal-Mart stock dives; HSBC orders pay cuts
text:
Squawk Box Live is keeping an eye on corporate news as Wal-Mart stock fell 10 percent after a profit warning, and HSBC reportedly notified staff of a 10 percent pay cut. 
Wal-Mart warned of a 12 percent drop in earnings in 2017 overnight, triggering a 10 percent slump in its share price and shaving $22 billion off the retailer's market capitalization. 
Staff at HSBC's investment banking unit have been ordered to take two weeks of unpaid leave and take a 10 percent pay cut in an effort to cut costs, according to reports.
We'll bring you the latest analysis below.
